import React from "react"; import "./About.css"; const About = () => { return (

About Alzheimer’s Disease

What is Alzheimer’s Disease?

Alzheimer's disease is a progressive neurological disorder that causes the brain to shrink and brain cells to die. It is the most common cause of dementia—a continuous decline in thinking, behavioral, and social skills.

Symptoms and Stages

  • Mild Stage: Memory loss, confusion, difficulty planning.
  • Moderate Stage: Trouble recognizing family, difficulty speaking, mood swings.
  • Severe Stage: Loss of physical abilities, inability to communicate, total dependence on caregivers.

Effects on Patients and Families

Alzheimer’s affects not just the individual but also their family and caregivers. Emotional, financial, and physical stress are common among families dealing with the disease.

Why Early Detection Matters?

  • Allows for early medical intervention and slowing disease progression.
  • Gives time for families to plan financial and caregiving needs.
  • Enables participation in clinical trials for potential treatments.

Causes and Risk Factors

The exact cause of Alzheimer’s is unknown, but factors such as age, genetics, head injuries, and cardiovascular diseases contribute to the risk.

Diagnosis and Treatment

  • Diagnosis: Cognitive tests, brain imaging (MRI, CT scans), and biomarker analysis.
  • Treatment: No cure, but medications like cholinesterase inhibitors and lifestyle changes can help manage symptoms.

Early detection can significantly improve the quality of life. Seek medical advice if you notice any symptoms.

); }; export default About;
